intro: Anthurium agoyanense var. eleutheroneuron, commonly known as the Eleutheroneuron anthurium, is a rare tropical plant native to the rainforests of Central America. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence consisting of a spadix and a spathe. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically green with a glossy surface. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, with the showy spathe serving as a pollination attractant. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
